review_title: Not all is well in health care
job_title: Surgial Tech in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: People work at this county facility because they like caring for the indigent and low income patients, additionally, covering all the trauma services. It takes really special people to do this work, so coworkers are awesome special!, they work hard and show great pride in their work  I respect my coworkers as well as like them as people.
cons:
ADMINSTRATION! From the top down! Middle management is the worst. Managers are promoted thru the "perter principal" meaning having "manager" in your title does not mean you do it well. Those in higher positions could really use some training in leadership, management, and communication skills. Additionally there exists huge inequity of treatment. Managers favor whomever they please,  bullying in common, and tolerated, it's become the common culture, the saying was never more true, "Nurses eat their young"
Also, get used to learning by fire. Work performance expectations, regardless of the training you receive, are high from the get-go. Learn office politics early on in order to succeed and survive. Get used to doing a lot of work and not getting credit for it. Friendly and helpful people should look elsewhere for a career; everyone is out for themselves.

job_title: ER Technician in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: Flexible Schedule, Paid Time Off
cons: Low Pay, Not enough staff

job_title: Registered Nurse in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: Coworkers are very nice, that is all I can say
cons: Very poor management. the leadership team does not care much about their staff. This so-called "nonprofit" hospital does not seem like putting their patient's and staff's benefits as a priority.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Kingsville, TX
pros: colleagues were like a family
cons: management was not very supportive

review_title: LOVE MY CO-WORKERS, BUT THAT'S ABOUT IT.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: Great teamwork on most units and learned a lot. Flexible work schedule for the most part.
cons:
Pay is not that great; didn't get a raise until over two years after I started working there. Got hired in at a certain rate (Corpus is considerably lower than national average), but found out other new grads were getting hired in at a couple more dollars an hour. As an experienced nurse, it was discouraging to find out that loyal, experienced employees were not getting paid at least the going rate or more. 
Upper management requires more and more of employees and does not compensate accordingly. They need to do more to retain their loyal employees as there were high turnover rates at times. I have also seen that they are trying to recruit from other cities and states, and are offering a ton more (even bonuses) money than what they pay their current employees. If you can get hired in from that angle, then that's the way to go.
I would only recommend this job to a friend because most of the employees are awesome.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: close to home, nice people.
cons: there was poor staff ratio. Med/surg was more on the stressful side.

review_title: Christus Spohn Health System Gets a B+
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: Great benefits in particular vision coverage. Frames are covered up to one hundred fifty dollars in network. This is a great plan because other vision plans cover less or they only give a small discount such as ten percent. They have flexible schedules in that they are willing to work with students around school schedules and they have a program called Grow Your Own in which full time associates can go to school full time and work part time and yet get compensated for full time hours. Overall the Christus Spohn Hospital is a great place to work and people are great.
cons: too much "nit picking" and peer animosity. This leads to lower employee morale and pay is not up to par with the level of work is required and does not match associate experience. Too much work load for the amount of staff on hand. In addition, new rules and regulations in pharmacy operations have made stress levels and employee morale decrease exponentially. This is due to management who believes that things can be one hundred percent correct, when in fact there will always be some errors. This is due to human nature and there is no way to be completely one hundred percent correct all the time.

job_title: Registered Nurse Medical Surgical in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: This is a good place to gain experience if you are a new nurse. Management doesn't support tenured nurses. Most of the good nurses leave after 1 to 2 years. But if  you want to get education money to finish your BSN and/or enough experience for your next job. This is the place to gain/obtain that experience.
cons: You have to fit into one of the clicks. Management has their favorites and if you aren't one of them don't expect any career growth. It is extremely fast paced, need the charge nurses to assist when it's too busy. Very difficult to ensure patient care when each nurse has 5 each.

review_title: Christus does not live its mission statement.  Organizational politics allow senior managers to avoid accountability.

review_title: HORRIBLE PLACE TO WORK AS A NURSE!!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: none-targeting and lying are the norm for management and other associates.
cons: Major shift in management many times. People put into management positions had little or no training. Lying to employees was the norm for many people. They do not even come close to adhering to their mission statement. Middle management bullies and targets people that come to them with issues and do not try to resolve any issues. Techs go outside their scope of practice on a daily basis and nothing is done. Dangerous place to work if you want to keep your license.

review_title: Paying for a new building and sacrificing patient care and employees

review_title: Large institution -A decent hospital to start a career but not a place for advancement or support in advancing a career

cons: No opportunities readily available for advancement. The hospital technology is really behind the times. A shortage of physicians -coupled with the A nursing shortage equals low morale and no opportunities to gain magnet status which would attract more nurses.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: There is great team work on the unit I am on. Everyone works very hard to help each other with patient care. You are able to pick your own days to work.
cons: Equipment is always broken. Management is never present and bias at times. Communication between night and day shift is non existant. Employees are rarely given raises. Employees are given multiple tasks to do which take away from patient care and then disciplined when there are poor patient satisfaction ratings.
